title: Southampton Central Travelodge : Rolex watch among items left behind
body_text:
A ROLEX watch worth thousands of pounds is among the items left behind at a budget hotel in Southampton in 2022.
The luxury, gold and diamond watch was found at Southampton Central Travelodge.
Other expensive or quirky items recovered by staff last year include tickets for a round the world Cunard cruise and a prenuptial agreement.
READ MORE: Southampton Travelodge refurbished with new 'budget-luxe' design
Each year, millions of people stay at the 582 Travelodge hotels across the UK, leaving behind hundreds, if not thousands, of objects.
Staff keep track of the most bizarre ones and a list is compiled at the end of every year.
The 2022 lost and found inventory report mentions an oil painting of Queen Elizabeth II, a replica of the late Queen's state imperial crown and a Liverpool Football Club themed wedding cake.
Travelodge spokeswoman, Shakila Ahmed, said: “With nearly 19 million customers annually staying at our 580 UK Travelodge hotels, including our hotels in Southampton, for thousands of different reasons, we do get a range of interesting items left behind. During 2022 this included a prenuptial agreement, a gold and diamond Rolex watch and a set of Air Pilot’s flight manuals.
“Interestingly the 2022 lost and found audit also revealed that we are a nation striving for a healthy lifestyle as we have seen a significant rise in smart watches being left behind in our Travelodge hotels during the last 12 months.
“When it comes to why so many of our customers forget their treasured items, it’s basically due to us all being time poor, juggling multiple tasks and being in a hurry to get from A to B. In the rush, valuable possessions are easily forgotten.”
Below are the most interesting findings from Travelodge hotels across Southampton.
Southampton Central Travelodge
- Gold and diamond Rolex
- Tickets for a round the world Cunard cruise
- A prenuptial agreement
Southampton Travelodge
- A large illustrated medical dictionary containing hand written notes
- A foldable e-scooter
- A set of Air Pilot’s flight manuals
Eastleigh Travelodge
- A vintage Singer sewing machine
- A box of UEFA Women's Euro 2022 flags
- A signed LA Lakers basketball shirt
- A Will with deeds to a coastal estate
